intro: Espeletia × almorzana, commonly known as the "Almorzana" or "Snowy Tree", is a hybrid plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and large, showy flower heads that resemble a tree-like structure. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments, typically above 3,000 meters, where it is adapted to cold and dry conditions. Its leaves are covered in a thick layer of white, cotton-like hairs, which help to insulate the plant and reduce water loss. Espeletia × almorzana is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to flourish in cool, sunny climates.
